page.title: 06Cardington
page.content:
Cardington is 3 miles south_east of Bedford. It has a population of 260. Most of them are elderly, there are very few families with young children. The large green hangars loom over the village. In St Mary's church there is a memorial to the victim's of the R1O1 disaster.
In the middle of the village is a green where the people met. They would have the fete or meetings. Around the green are the church, the old school, the pub, a few old houses, Home Farm and the village hall.
There are no shops in Cardington only a small post office. For shopping and work the villages must go to Bedford or other towns. The old school is now the home of the Rural Community Council.
